name: Gperf
body:
### Welcome to Gperf homepage.
Gperf is Graphing performance or system activity information using the output of `sar` tools.
It's Open Source, you can clone the repository:

```
$ git clone git://github.com/sakti/gperf.git
$ cd gperf
```

### Requirements
- matplotlib


### Installation

You can use `pip` or `easy_install` to install gperf.

```
$ pip install gperf
```

### How to use

```
    Usage: gperf.py [options]

    Options:
      -h, --help            show this help message and exit
      -i INPUT_FILE, --input=INPUT_FILE
      -o OUTPUT_DIR, --ouput=OUTPUT_DIR
      --csv                 
      --stat                
      --minor               
      --height=HEIGHT       
      --width=WIDTH   
```

Recording all system activity.

``` 
    $ sar -A -o [output filename] [interval]

    $ sar -A -o activity_result 1
```

Convert result format into csv.

```
    
    $ sadf -d -- -A [output filename] > [csv filename]

    $ sadf -d -- -A activity_result > activity_result.csv

```

Create graph form `-d` format form sadf.

```
    $ python gperf.py -i activity_result.csv -o output_dir

    or

    $ python gperf.py --input activity_result.csv --output output_dir
```

### Bugs & Issues
You can create / report issue in https://github.com/sakti/gperf/issues
